snippet: Mr. Makol, who helped secure cooperative testimony in cases against the chief of Galleon Group and others, is joining the market-abuse unit at the Securities and Exchange Commission.
abstract: David Makol, FBI agent who made name for himself investigating insider trading, returns to the Securities and Exchange Commission as a forensic accountant in its market-abuse unit.

byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: Mr. Makol, who helped secure cooperative testimony in cases against the chief of Galleon Group and others, is joining the market-abuse unit at the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: David Makol, Known for Pursuit of Insider Trading Cases While at F.B.I., Joins S.E.C.
headline.print_headline: Foe of Inside Trading at F.B.I. Joins S.E.C.
